p: It is worth mentioning here that the soil of the abandoned fields habitat attained high content of organic matter and nutrients ( Table 2). This high resource availability could be responsible for more invasion by A. ochroleuca, aligned with the resource fluctuation hypothesis, which proposes that high resource availability facilitates invasion [ 52]. In addition, human disturbance in some habitats, such as cultivated and abandoned fields and roadsides, may increase the environmental heterogeneity that facilitates the invasibility by increasing the availability of resources, or by decreasing competition [ 7, 60].
